d罪犯見到gun free zone係唔係會乖乖地換把刀？

其實呢排BLM+武肺勁多人買槍同子彈
好多嘢斷貨

As a patriotic American, when it comes to talking about my country's right to keep and bear arm, I would like to say something and I hope y'all don't mind me replying in English.

The Second Amendment is a God given right proposed by our great Founding Fathers to provide self defense and protection against any type of corrupt and abusive government.

"A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms, shall not be infringed." Pretty self explanatory here.

Nothing says freedom and America like being able to own firearms and use it to protect your assets, private property and family from tyrants. Let alone forming a militia with your boogbois.

Owning a gun is like arms race with soviet union except your opponent this time is anyone who is trying to do you harm here at home. This includes the government, police, criminals, people who have intention to do harm to you, your property, your family, your loved ones or even strangers.

History have shown us how having the right to keep and bear arms matter. If you look back to the American Civil War, the North infringed the South's right to secede from the Union and the South did not have as much advanced weaponry as the North due to the Industrial Revolution helped the Union a lot. Let alone the South was already lacking manpower to fight back Lincoln's tyrannical regime and because of that the South eventually had to surrender. This is a perfect example to show how seceding from your own government would not end well if the tyrant have more advanced weaponry.

Now moving on to AR, the term Assault Rifle was created by evil politicians to promote gun bans and it has nothing to do with the original name - ArmaLite Rifle which they developed the whole design back in the 1950s.

Here is my opinion on banning ARs.
I think banning ARs is not a practical way to reduce gun violence but instead it infringes law abiding citizens' individual freedom to keep and bear arms and strip away the right for them to self defense from tyrants. Like some of y'all already said that Guns DO NOT Kill People, People Kill People.

Stats have shown that ~287,400 prisoners had possessed a firearm during their offense. More than half of them got their firearm from underground market, found it at scene of crime or either stolen. The rest had it obtained from family members, friends or as a gift. Only 7% were purchased under their name from a licensed firearm dealer.

Let me add something here, I do agree a certain level of gun regulation since we are talking about a nation with a population of ~330 million. It is important to ensure the quality and mental wellness of American gun owners. I think that there should be an Universal Mental Health screening protocol prior to purchasing of any firearm and that felons should not be able to acquire any firearm.

What politicians need to do is to remove the bad stigma of gun and promote more actual firearm education into the mind of the masses. I am not a big fan of communism but Russia do a hell of a job on teaching safe handling of firearms.
Besides that I think creating a wholesome gun image in pop culture can do a lot into educating the youth and future generations about guns. Rap music have done so much harm in promoting gang violence, using guns to kill people and mimicking the sound of shooting and I think people should be smart enough to realize it now to make a change.

GOD BLESS AMERICA

quote.msg:
As a patriotic American, when it comes to talking about my country's right to keep and bear arm, I would like to say something and I hope y'all don't mind me replying in English.

The Second Amendment is a God given right proposed by our great Founding Fathers to provide self defense and protection against any type of corrupt and abusive government.

"A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms, shall not be infringed." Pretty self explanatory here.

Nothing says freedom and America like being able to own firearms and use it to protect your assets, private property and family from tyrants. Let alone forming a militia with your boogbois.

Owning a gun is like arms race with soviet union except your opponent this time is anyone who is trying to do you harm here at home. This includes the government, police, criminals, people who have intention to do harm to you, your property, your family, your loved ones or even strangers.

History have shown us how having the right to keep and bear arms matter. If you look back to the American Civil War, the North infringed the South's right to secede from the Union and the South did not have as much advanced weaponry as the North due to the Industrial Revolution helped the Union a lot. Let alone the South was already lacking manpower to fight back Lincoln's tyrannical regime and because of that the South eventually had to surrender. This is a perfect example to show how seceding from your own government would not end well if the tyrant have more advanced weaponry.

Now moving on to AR, the term Assault Rifle was created by evil politicians to promote gun bans and it has nothing to do with the original name - ArmaLite Rifle which they developed the whole design back in the 1950s.

Here is my opinion on banning ARs.
I think banning ARs is not a practical way to reduce gun violence but instead it infringes law abiding citizens' individual freedom to keep and bear arms and strip away the right for them to self defense from tyrants. Like some of y'all already said that Guns DO NOT Kill People, People Kill People.

Stats have shown that ~287,400 prisoners had possessed a firearm during their offense. More than half of them got their firearm from underground market, found it at scene of crime or either stolen. The rest had it obtained from family members, friends or as a gift. Only 7% were purchased under their name from a licensed firearm dealer.

Let me add something here, I do agree a certain level of gun regulation since we are talking about a nation with a population of ~330 million. It is important to ensure the quality and mental wellness of American gun owners. I think that there should be an Universal Mental Health screening protocol prior to purchasing of any firearm and that felons should not be able to acquire any firearm.

What politicians need to do is to remove the bad stigma of gun and promote more actual firearm education into the mind of the masses. I am not a big fan of communism but Russia do a hell of a job on teaching safe handling of firearms.
Besides that I think creating a wholesome gun image in pop culture can do a lot into educating the youth and future generations about guns. Rap music have done so much harm in promoting gang violence, using guns to kill people and mimicking the sound of shooting and I think people should be smart enough to realize it now to make a change.

GOD BLESS AMERICA

quote.msg:
As a patriotic American, when it comes to talking about my country's right to keep and bear arm, I would like to say something and I hope y'all don't mind me replying in English.

The Second Amendment is a God given right proposed by our great Founding Fathers to provide self defense and protection against any type of corrupt and abusive government.

"A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms, shall not be infringed." Pretty self explanatory here.

Nothing says freedom and America like being able to own firearms and use it to protect your assets, private property and family from tyrants. Let alone forming a militia with your boogbois.

Owning a gun is like arms race with soviet union except your opponent this time is anyone who is trying to do you harm here at home. This includes the government, police, criminals, people who have intention to do harm to you, your property, your family, your loved ones or even strangers.

History have shown us how having the right to keep and bear arms matter. If you look back to the American Civil War, the North infringed the South's right to secede from the Union and the South did not have as much advanced weaponry as the North due to the Industrial Revolution helped the Union a lot. Let alone the South was already lacking manpower to fight back Lincoln's tyrannical regime and because of that the South eventually had to surrender. This is a perfect example to show how seceding from your own government would not end well if the tyrant have more advanced weaponry.

Now moving on to AR, the term Assault Rifle was created by evil politicians to promote gun bans and it has nothing to do with the original name - ArmaLite Rifle which they developed the whole design back in the 1950s.

Here is my opinion on banning ARs.
I think banning ARs is not a practical way to reduce gun violence but instead it infringes law abiding citizens' individual freedom to keep and bear arms and strip away the right for them to self defense from tyrants. Like some of y'all already said that Guns DO NOT Kill People, People Kill People.

Stats have shown that ~287,400 prisoners had possessed a firearm during their offense. More than half of them got their firearm from underground market, found it at scene of crime or either stolen. The rest had it obtained from family members, friends or as a gift. Only 7% were purchased under their name from a licensed firearm dealer.

Let me add something here, I do agree a certain level of gun regulation since we are talking about a nation with a population of ~330 million. It is important to ensure the quality and mental wellness of American gun owners. I think that there should be an Universal Mental Health screening protocol prior to purchasing of any firearm and that felons should not be able to acquire any firearm.

What politicians need to do is to remove the bad stigma of gun and promote more actual firearm education into the mind of the masses. I am not a big fan of communism but Russia do a hell of a job on teaching safe handling of firearms.
Besides that I think creating a wholesome gun image in pop culture can do a lot into educating the youth and future generations about guns. Rap music have done so much harm in promoting gang violence, using guns to kill people and mimicking the sound of shooting and I think people should be smart enough to realize it now to make a change.

GOD BLESS AMERICA

replies.msg:
錯誤類比喎

海灘：有方法identify到鯊魚並有方法阻止鯊魚進入（安全網）

槍：無辦法identify誰想開槍殺人，所以先要有 gun control + background check。background check 唔完美，以致文明國家都有幾種做法

一種係嚴厲槍械管制 (restrictive licensing, background check），減低槍械留入市面，只容許有必要人仕管有槍械（例如打獵）。英國和加拿大係最成功的例子。

二係全禁，例如日本。但本身犯罪率好低，無可比性。

三係有槍械管制，但比起英國未算好嚴厲，例如德國。有嚴格背景審查，槍牌政策比英國寬鬆，持槍人數比較多，但槍擊案比率低。但係德國本身罪案率低，都係無可比性。

四係象徵式background check，幾乎係人都買到槍，例如美國。

仲有就係要比較埋犯罪率

日本、香港、星加坡、德國呢啲本身犯罪率低嘅地方，用來做例子其實唔適合

適合作比較的例子係禁槍前後的加拿大和英國，全部都有二十年以上的客觀數據分析，有力證明槍擊案數目同槍械數目有直接關係

當然啦，英國和加拿大係民主國家，平民唔需要槍械來對抗極權政府和死黑警

thanks for sharing

去海灘游水
被鯊魚咬死既機率會提高幾十倍
所以大家唔應該再去海灘游水

錯誤類比喎

海灘：有方法identify到鯊魚並有方法阻止鯊魚進入（安全網）

槍：無辦法identify誰想開槍殺人，所以先要有 gun control + background check。background check 唔完美，以致文明國家都有幾種做法

一種係嚴厲槍械管制 (restrictive licensing, background check），減低槍械留入市面，只容許有必要人仕管有槍械（例如打獵）。英國和加拿大係最成功的例子。

二係全禁，例如日本。但本身犯罪率好低，無可比性。

三係有槍械管制，但比起英國未算好嚴厲，例如德國。有嚴格背景審查，槍牌政策比英國寬鬆，持槍人數比較多，但槍擊案比率低。但係德國本身罪案率低，都係無可比性。

四係象徵式background check，幾乎係人都買到槍，例如美國。

仲有就係要比較埋犯罪率

日本、香港、星加坡、德國呢啲本身犯罪率低嘅地方，用來做例子其實唔適合

適合作比較的例子係禁槍前後的加拿大和英國，全部都有二十年以上的客觀數據分析，有力證明槍擊案數目同槍械數目有直接關係

當然啦，英國和加拿大係民主國家，平民唔需要槍械來對抗極權政府和死黑警

replies.msg: 其實美國唔同州分background check 嘅嚴厲程度都唔同，仲有唔同法律去配合槍權問題(例如把槍可唔可以show 出嚟等等)。所以單單用成個美國嘅數字嚟睇，好難反映真實情況
